title: Upper Delaware Scenic & Recreational River: Backyard Biology
body: Backyard Biology        Children learn more about the aquatic life in the Delaware River.    Â        Rangers will guide the children through experiments related to plant development, density, and the food web. The program will also include art projects and games related to fish and wildlife. Backyard Biology will take place every Wednesday morning at 10:30am beginning July 1, 2015 and running through August 12th. The program will take place in the backyard of the Zane Grey Museum in Lackawaxen, PA. To register for this program or for additional information please contact Chief of Interpretation Ingrid Peterec at 570-685-4871 or email: e-mail us The program is free of charge. There is a limit of 20 children for this program.  Backyard Biology and River Readings Flyer
